Rings of Krull type
By Malcolm Griffin at Wellington ( New Zealand ) ^ )
1.  Introduction
A family Ü of valuations of a field К is said to be of fi?  iite character if all but a finite number of the valuations of Ü are zero at each non zero element of K. 
If w ^Q has ring Ш^ and maximal ideal ^ then A = П SR^ is said to be the ring
we ß defined by Ü and ^ r> ^ is a prime ideal,  called the centre of w on A and denoted Z ( w ), 
If the ring of fractions ^^ ( ^ ) = ^ft^y then w is called an essential { valuation. 
Let A be defined by a family of finite character Ü with each w^ü essential for A ;
then A is called a ring of Krull type. 
We show that the approximation theorem holds for a ring of Krull type and use it to study the ^ideals of a ring of Krull type.  If A is defined by a family of finite character then Л is a Prüfer ring if and only if the reinforced approximation theorem holds.  Two examples of rings of Krull type are provided. 
2.  The Weak approximation Theorem
Let jT be a totally ordered group.  A subgroup Л of P is called an isolated subgroup if ( 5 e zl,  7 € Г with ( 5 ^ 7 ^ 0 imply that у^Л, 
Let w^ w' be valuations of К with groups Г,  Г' and rings Ш^ Ш'.  If 91 ^ 9Î' we say that w' is coarser than w and write w' ^ w.  If го' ^ w then for some prime ideal ^ of 3Î,  Ж ^ dicß and Г " ^ P / Zl,  where A is the isolated subgroup of Г generated by the values of those elements of 91 which do not belong to ^. 
Since the valuations coarser than w are totally ordered there will be a finest valuation w " = w к w' coarser than both w and w\ Let A and Л' be the corresponding subgroups of Г and Г' and let ср\Г - ^Г1Л and q ) ' : Г' - > F'jA',  Then we have isomorphisms Г " ^FjA ^Г'1А\ and we shall identify these three groups by means of these morphisms.  If Zl = / ",  w " is the trivial valuation and we say that w and w' are independent. 
We say that ( л :,  ос' ) ^ Г x Г' is compatible if q ) { ( x ) = cp' { oc' ).  Let { w^^^j be a family of valuations of К with groups Г^,  Then { ( x ) ^^j^ П Г^ is called compatible if every pair ( л : ^,  a^ ^ r^ X Г^ is compatible. 
^ ) Part of the research done for a Ph.  D.  degree at Queen's University,  Kingston,  Ontario,  under the direction of Dr.  Paulo Ribenboim,  with financial assistance from the National Research Council of Canada. 
Journal für Mathematik.  Bd.  229 1
